item.title: On Clearing Prices in Matching Markets: A Simple Characterization without Duality
item.description: This is a note about market-clearing prices in a matching market, where we prove that: (1) the space of market-clearing prices is convex; (2) the space of market-learning prices is closed under element-wise maximum and minimum operations; (3) any market-clearing prices induce all maximum matchings. We prove these claims using elementary mathematics, instead of using the classical yet opaque approach that relies on duality of linear programming.
